title: Bug 3666 - Hungry code assist
description: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. For example, when adding a parameter to the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method of the provided class, the code assist replaces more code than expected.
OB: The observed behavior is that the code is changed to 'baz(x.foo()x.foo())' instead of 'baz(x.foo());'.
EB: The expected behavior is that the code assist should only replace the code inside the method call, without removing any other part of the line of code.
SR:
Follow these steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Open the provided class.
2. Inside the 'baz' method call in the 'bar' method, try to add a new parameter.
3. Observe how the code assist replaces more code than expected.
